body: TLDR: Japanese love self inserting into fiction because they know their lives are extremely mundane. The reason why any form of entertainment they produce is successful there as means to escape from reality. Their birth rates are staggering low because the men there are more and more becoming Hikikimorri's which is pathetic. 6000 reported women yearly enter the adult industry. Japan is not at as great as you think. Well atleast I'm grateful I get to beat my dick to good shit.

This "gudao" thing? Nah, he is like the persona5 mc, meant as a general idealized character for the japs to self-insert into, has way too much personality and is generally portrayed as flawless who is never wrong and always gets everything in his game, which comes off as if the entire game is his "palace" and you who payed atlus to play it and witness one of the ultimate wish fulfillment media in jap history where everything always goes well once he gets the persona main character's special snowflake powers. Can you really "relate" to a character who always gets their way and no matter what they do, they always get away with it for being "the one who the author granted the highest plot armor"? Are there others who can summon "servants"? only he or its sex inverted version (which for some reason has red hair and eyes) can summon/control servants, (that you can play as). This "gudeo" character is like "teitoku","gran","producer","shikikan". You play through them instead of playing asthem

Link, from the older Zelda games (NES-SNES-GB/GBC-N64 and TP from the NGC/WII) where better suited for "self-insertion" despite Link being blond and well the majority aren't (asians), still, his "character" being a blank slate with minimal character, expression and communication made him, despite physical difference, a suitable self-insert character, the latest iterations are too expressive and have too much character. "Claude" from GTA3 was a very suitable candidate for self-inserting, again, minimal/none expressions and only form of communication is head nodding and deadly violence, Persona 4 main character from a design point as well as personality, was a near perfect character for self-inserting (white hair, grey eyes, neutral personality when not in a spin-off game). pokemon gen 1 - 4 trainers too, they had nothing but [Yes] and [No] dialogue, zero personality, character, expression and a not too specific design that was easier to intake, can't say the same about gen 5 and beyond.

@Lord Jeanne, Duc d’Orléans, @354 imagine getting mad at a Self-Insert character KeK, we reaching new levels of and inferiority complex, I'm not even mad, I'm just cackling at the thought that people are mad at am avatar being used as an avatar is supposed to be used LOOOOOOOOL, we don't have clowns here we got the entire CIRCUS KEKW
